poem:
**Rewinding Joy**

When the world dims its lights,  
I queue up the flicker of laughter,  
popcorn in hand,  
where romance bends like light  
through an old windowpane,  
a familiar script unfolding,  
the characters leaning in  
to whisper that all is well,  
and for two fleeting hours  
I bask in the glow of dreams.
